snippet: A primary campaign between John L. Mica and Sandy Adams in Florida, with voting next Tuesday, in many ways encapsulates the central conflict that has divided House Republicans in the 112th Congress.
abstract: Increasingly nasty Republican primary in central Florida between Rep Sandy Adams and Rep John L Mica encapsulates the central conflict that has divided House Republicans in the 112th Congress; Adams, a freshman endorsed by the Tea Party, is attempting to frame the long-established Mica as a big spender who is out of step with the party and the nation.
lead_paragraph: A primary campaign between John L. Mica and Sandy Adams in Florida, with voting next Tuesday, in many ways encapsulates the central conflict that has divided House Republicans in the 112th Congress.

headline.seo: Primary in Florida Echoes Republican Battles
headline.main: A Heated House Primary in Florida Echoes the Republicans’ Internal Battles
headline.print_headline: A Heated House Primary in Florida Echoes the Republicans’ Internal Battles
